sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Cheirexokē [sic] the excellency or handy-vvork of the royal hand. Allen, Thomas, d. 1684. Harris, Thomas, 17th cent.
[6], 37 p.
Printed by William Godbid for the author, London : 1665.
Title transliterated from Greek. "The epistle dedicatory" signed: T.A., M.D. Written by Dr. Thomas Allen. Cf. Halkett & Laing. Cf. also Wm. Beckett's Enquiry in the antiquity and efficacy of touching for the king's evil, 1722, p. 58: "Dr. Thomas Allen, sometime of Caius College in Cambridge, afterward physician in ordinary to King Charles the Second, published a treatise of the cure of the evil by the touch, which he entitles, 'The excellency or handy-work of the royal hand'." BM attributes to either Allen or to Thomas Harris. Reproduction of original in Bodleian Library.
=======
